intro: Oxytropis reverdattoi, commonly known as the Sierra Madre locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is known for its toxic alkaloids, which can affect livestock and wildlife. Oxytropis reverdattoi plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for certain insect species.
